attributes.comment:
Because adoptions are taking longer, many families now have to go through the
USCIS fingerprinting and I600A process twice. So, the once total cost of $685
doubles to $1370 if the fees remain the same. If the fees increase this could jump
to $1660. This is a very large increase. How will the services reflect the increase?
Because waiting for the results of the fingerprinting and the I600A approval took
the longest during the compilation of the dossier. From time of application to
approval was over 2 months. This is a long time when considering a child is
waiting for a family and a family anxious to get their child. It would be a great
disservice to many waiting children and their future families to increase fees
without enhancing the service.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kelly Bockelmann
